com.samysadi.acs.virtualization.job.operation

Interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Operation<Resource>, Probed, RunnableEntity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputingOperationDefault, NetworkOperationDefault, StorageOperationDefault, SynchronizableLongOperationImpl

    public interface SynchronizableOperation<Resource>
extends Operation<Resource>
    An operation that can be synchronized with other operations.
    Since:
    1.2
    See Also:
    OperationSynchronizer

    • Method Detail

      • getOperationSynchronizer

        OperationSynchronizer getOperationSynchronizer()

      • startSynchronization

        void startSynchronization(OperationSynchronizer operationSynchronizer)
        Call this method so that the current operation will adjust its allocated resource in order to finish (ie: to be completed) after running for at least the delay returned by OperationSynchronizer.getSynchronizationDelay().

        Calling this method will guarantee that this operation needs to be running for at least that delay before it becomes completed.
        But this method does not guarantee that the operation will be completed after it has been running for exactly that delay. If the operation gets a too low resource promise from its provisioner, then it may still need extra running time to be completed.

        If OperationSynchronizer.getSynchronizationDelay() returns a negative delay, then the current operation is delayed (i.e. will run forever).

        Additionally, after calling this method, and if OperationSynchronizer.isSynchronizeDelayBeforeCompletion() returns true, then current operation is delayed before completion. In such case, for the operation to resume, you need to pause the operation, call stopSynchronization() and resume it.

        Note: You should not need to call this method directly. If you need to synchronize an operation with an other, then use synchronizeWith(SynchronizableOperation) or OperationSynchronizer.addOperation(SynchronizableOperation).

        Parameters:
        operationSynchronizer - the operationSynchronizer
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this operation is running

      • stopSynchronization

        void stopSynchronization()
        Call this method to clear any synchronization restrictions that were set using startSynchronization(OperationSynchronizer).

        Note: You should not need to call this method directly. If you need to stop synchronizing an operation then use cancelSynchronization() or OperationSynchronizer.removeOperation(SynchronizableOperation).

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this operation is running

      • synchronizeWith

        void synchronizeWith(SynchronizableOperation<?> operation)
        Synchronizes current operation with the given operation.

        This method will create an OperationSynchronizer and add both the current operation and the given operation to it.

        If current operation or the given operation is already synchronized then a new OperationSynchronizer is created, and all operations synchronized with either current operation or the given operation are added to the new OperationSynchronizer.

        Parameters:
        operation -

      • cancelSynchronization

        void cancelSynchronization()
        Removes current operation from its OperationSynchronizer (see getOperationSynchronizer()).

        If current operation is not synchronized (has no defined OperationSynchronizer) then nothing is done.
